properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 13 at 9:07PM EST until February 14 at 9:15AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has extended
the

* Flood Advisory for...
West central Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North
Carolina...
Southeastern Gaston County in the Piedmont of North Carolina...

* Until 915 AM EST Friday.

* At 905 PM EST, high flows continued along the Catawba River
reservoir chain. As a result of excess water passing though each
lake, the pool height at Mountain Island Lake should hover around
101.5 feet overnight and into Friday morning. This will continue
to result in nuisance shoreline flooding of lake access areas,
docks, and residential yards along and downstream of the lake.

* Residents should take immediate actions to protect property
adjacent to Mountain Island Lake and the Catawba River, closely
monitor lake levels for sudden changes, and follow guidance from
Charlotte-Mecklenburg Emergency Management. Drivers are encouraged
to heed any barricades and avoid all flooded areas.

* For more information on lake levels or dam releases, people are
encouraged to visit http://lakes.duke-energy.com, call 1-800-829-
5253, or download the Duke Energy Lake View mobile app.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
